document.docAuthor: Costa, Erika L. S. & Ruiz, Gustavo R. S.
document.docTitle: Scopocira kunai Costa & Ruiz, 2014, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of Scopocira Simon, 1900 (Araneae: Salticidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of Scopocira Simon, 1900 (Araneae: Salticidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Types . Holotype :
Male from Acampamento Mutum, Juruti, Pará, Brazil ,
04.VIII. 2004
, D.R. Santos-Souza, deposited in MPEG 8874 .
Paratypes :
two females from Igarapé Mutum (
1.612417 ºS
,
56.194222 ºW
),
04.VIII. 2004
, D.F. Candiani ( MPEG 8860 ),
05.VIII. 2004
, D.F. Candiani ( MPEG 8895 ); one male from Mount Zion, Loango, Trinidad , Trinidad & Tobago [
10.7 ºN
61.4 ºW
],
06.VII. 1999
, G.B. Edwards ( FSCA ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 141–143.
S. crotalica
sp. nov. 141 male, dorsal view; 142 left male palp, ventral view; 143 same, retrolateral view. Scale bar=1 mm (141); 0.25 mm (142–143).

FIGURES 144–149.
S. cyrili
sp. nov. 144 male, dorsal view; 145 left male palp, ventral view; 146 same, retrolateral view; 147 female, dorsal view; 148 epigyne, ventral view; 149 same, cleared, dorsal view. Scale bar=1 mm (144, 147); 0.25 mm (145–146, 148–149).

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The specific epithet, to be treated as a Latin noun in apposition, was a Japanese ninja weapon similar to the embolus of the male palp of this species.

Diagnosis . Males of S.
kunai
are similar to those of
S. cyrili
and
S. tenella
by having a broad embolus tip; from
S. tenella
it differs by not having a developed ITA; from
S. cyrili
it can be recognized by having a smaller paraembolic projection (
Fig. 163
). Female spermathecae are more similar to those of
S. tenella
, but are more rounded (
Fig. 167
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 150–155.
S. fuscimana
. 150 male, dorsal view; 151 left male palp, ventral view; 152 same, retrolateral view; 153 female, dorsal view; 154 epigyne, ventral view; 155 same, cleared, dorsal view. Scale bar=1 mm (150, 153); 0.25 mm (151–152, 154–155).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female ( MPEG 8895 ).
Total length: 3.21 . Carapace orange, 1.46 long, 0.98 wide, 0.63 high (
Fig. 165
). Ocular quadrangle 0.87 long. Anterior eye row 0.98 wide and posterior 0.88 wide. Legs 4132 , yellow. Length of femur: I 0.95 , II 0.75 , III 0.77 , IV 1.08 ; patella + tibia: I 1.24 , II 0.96 , III 0.83 , IV 1.23 ; metatarsus + tarsus: I 0.97 , II 0.81 , III 0.94 , IV 1.25 . Spination as in male. Abdomen as in male; pattern more conspicuous. Epigyne as in
Figs 166‒167
.
